member.value: true if tabs can close when a middle-click is performed over them; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.value: true if the drop-down menu button is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsLayoutAnimationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether animation effects are applied during layout, such as when tabs are added or removed.
member.value: true if animation effects are applied during layout, such as when tabs are added or removed; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsOverflowed
member.summary: Gets whether the tabs are overflowed.
member.value: true if the tabs are overflowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsTabContentHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tab content layout is in a horizontal orientation.
member.value: true if the tab content layout is in a horizontal orientation; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsTabKeyboardAccessEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether keyboard access to directly select a tab is enabled.
member.value: true if keyboard access to directly select a tab is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When enabled, Ctrl+1 will activate the first tab in a normal state, with Ctrl+2 activating the second normal tab, and so on. Ctrl+Alt+1 will activate the first tab in a pinned state, with Ctrl+Alt+2 activating the second pinned tab, and so on.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsTabKeyboardSwitchingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether keyboard access to switch to the previous/next tab is enabled.
member.value: true if keyboard access to switch to the previous/next tab is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When enabled, Ctrl+Tab will switch to the next tab and Ctrl+Shift+Tab will switch to the previous tab.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.AdvancedTabControl.IsTabStripVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tabstrip is visible.
member.value: true if the tabstrip is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockingWindow.SerializationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique ID to use when matching up windows with serialized layout data.
member.value: The unique ID to use when matching up windows with serialized layout data.
member.remarks: When deserializing a saved layout, the layout information has to be matched up with related windows, which is done via this property. Each window needs to have a unique serialization ID, specified by this property. When this property is , the window's Name property will be used instead. While the Name property must conform to standard .NET identifier syntax, this property can use any characters in its value.

member.summary: Gets or sets an optional name that specifies a group of windows that have an affinity.
member.value: The optional name that specifies a group of windows that have an affinity.
member.remarks: Say that there are three windows that should generally be attached together. All of them should be assigned the same group name (e.g. Bottom). When a window is first opened and no previous location is found for it, it will search for other windows that are already open in the same state and have the same group name. If any are found, it will default to attaching to the most recently activated one.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.FloatingWindowSnapToScreenThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum length of a floating window that must be visible over a screen's edge to avoid snap-to-screen.
member.value: The minimum length of a floating window that must be visible over a screen's edge to avoid snap-to-screen. The default value is 70.0.
member.remarks: This feature is only used when the property is true. If a floating window is completely beyond the screen edge, it will be fully snapped back onto the screen. If a floating window is only partially beyond the screen edge, but the visible portion is less than this property's value, it will be snapped partially back onto the screen.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.FloatingWindowTitle

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.IsFloatingWindowSnapToScreenEnabled

member.value: true if floating windows are snapped onto the closest screen when displayed via a method other than being dragged; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.MagnetismGapDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism.
member.value: The distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, there will be a gap between windows that are snapped together when magnetism is enabled by the property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.MagnetismSnapDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged.
member.value: The distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged. The default value is 5.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, magnetism is enabled. Set it to 0 to disable magnetism. Magnetism tries to snap corners of a window being dragged to other window corners around it. Increase this property's value to increase the range over which the magnetism will work. Magnetism also takes effect when resizing via window borders.

member.remarks: This setting does not affect tabbed MDI, since has its own property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsHaveTitleBarIcons
member.summary: Gets or sets the global setting for whether tool window title bars display the icon of the selected tool window.
member.value: true if tool window title bars display the icon of the selected tool window; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsHaveTitleBars
member.summary: Gets or sets the global setting for whether tool windows display a title bar when not in MDI.
member.value: true if tool windows display a title bar when not in MDI; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This setting only affects tool windows whose property is set to . Any other setting on the tool window instance overrides this global setting.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsHaveToggleAutoHideButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets whether controls can have title bar toggle auto-hide buttons.
member.value: true if controls can have title bar toggle auto-hide buttons; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsSingleTabLayoutBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the global setting for the behavior used when a single tool window is in a container.
member.value: The behavior used when a single tool window is in a container. The default value is SingleTabLayoutBehavior.Hide.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsTabOverflowBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the global setting for the overflow behavior of the tool window tabs.
member.value: The overflow behavior of the tool window tabs. The default value is TabOverflowBehavior.Shrink.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsTabStripPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a indicating the side upon which the tool window tabs are located.
member.value: A indicating the side upon which the tool window tabs are located. The default value is Bottom.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowsTitleBarContextContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of tool window container title bar context content.
member.value: The alignment of tool window container title bar context content. The default value is Far.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.ToolWindowTabItemContainerStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the to use for rendering the tab item containers in a .
member.value: The to use for rendering the tab item containers in a .

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.UseDragFloatPreviews
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use float previews when dragging windows instead of instantly creating floating windows.
member.value: true if float previews should be used when dragging windows instead of instantly creating floating windows; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property should be set to true when docking window content contains a large number of elements that may not measure/arrange quickly. When this property is true, fewer layout cycles occur since a float preview is used to show where the floating window will be created instead of instantly moving the dragged windows into a floating window.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.UseHostedFloatingWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether floating windows should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site.
member.value: true if floating windows should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Due to security restrictions with the Window class in XBAPs, when used in an XBAP, a value of true will be forced.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.UseHostedPopups
member.summary: Gets or sets whether popups should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site.
member.value: true if popups should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property should be false only in Windows applications where you expect to host interop (Windows Forms, DirectX, etc.) controls. If you do not plan on hosting interop controls, leave it true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.CanUpdateItemsSourceOnUnregister
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to try and remove an item from its items source when the related container is unregistered.
member.value: true if the item should try to be removed; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This feature is only active when using the or properties, and the functionality only works if the items source implements IList and is not read-only. Otherwise, the event should be monitored and the items source updated manually.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.SplitContainer.ResizeSlots(System.Double[])
member.summary: Resizes the slots based on the specified ratios, if any.
member.param: This list of zero or more desired ratios.
member.remarks: If contains 0-1 items, then the slots will be resized equally. Otherwise, the specified ratio will be applied to the associated slot (i.e. the slot that shared the same index). If there are more slots than there are desired ratios, then the last ratio will be repeated for the remaining slots.

member.summary: Represents a tool window.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.Attach(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.IDockTarget)
member.summary: Attaches the to the specified target, generally making a tabbed group.
member.param: The against which to attach.
member.remarks: The can be another docking window, , or . Use the method to dock to the side of the target instead.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.AutoHide
member.summary: Auto-hides the to the closest outer-edge of the ancestor .
member.remarks: Using this method places the in an AutoHide. Use the method overload to auto-hide to a specific side.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.AutoHide(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Side)
member.summary: Auto-hides the to the specified outer-edge of the ancestor .
member.param: A indicating the side upon which to auto-hide.
member.remarks: Using this method places the in an AutoHide. Use the method overload to auto-hide to the control's default side.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.Dock
member.summary: Docks the back to its default docked location.
member.remarks: Using this method places the in a Docked. If the tool window isn't currently open or isn't in a Docked state, it will attempt to restore to the previous docked location. If one isn't available, a default docked location will be selected based on , , and .

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.Dock(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.IDockTarget,ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Side)
member.summary: Docks the to the side of a specified target.
member.param: The that is the target of the dock.
The target's against which to dock.
member.remarks: Use the method overload to dock back to its previous docked location. Use the method to dock into a particular target.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.Float(System.Nullable{System.Windows.Point},System.Nullable{System.Windows.Size})
member.summary: Floats the to the specified optional location and size.
member.param: An optional specifying the target location of the floating dock host.
An optional specifying the target size of the floating dock host.
member.remarks: When is not specified, it will float to a default location. When is not specified, it will float with its current size. Using this method places the in a Docked within a floating dock host.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.GetCurrentSide
member.summary: Returns a indicating where the tool window is located, if it is currently open.
member.returns: A indicating where the tool window is located, if it is currently open.
member.remarks: If the tool window is open in a Document state, is returned. If the tool window is open in an AutoHide state, the auto-hide dock is returned. If the tool window is open in a Docked state and the containing dock host has a workspace (no tool window inner-fill), a indicating the location of the tool window relative to the workspace is returned. If the tool window is open in a Docked state and the containing dock host does not has a workspace (tool window inner-fill is active), a indicating the location of the tool window's midpoint relative to the dock host's bounds is returned. Otherwise, if the tool window is closed, is returned.

member.summary: Returns an object for this control instance.
member.returns: An instance.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.Serialization.DockSiteLayoutSerializer.CanKeepExistingDocumentWindowsOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets whether existing open document windows are kept open during a layout serialization that affects the MDI area, even when they aren't listed in the loaded layout data.
member.value: true if existing open document windows are kept open during a layout serialization that affects the MDI area, even when they aren't listed in the loaded layout data; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.Serialization.DockSiteLayoutSerializer.CanSerializeUnusedLazyLoadData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether unused lazy load data can be serialized.
member.value: true if unused lazy load data can be serialized; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When a layout is deserialized and or are , lazy load data is stored for the windows if windows in the layout are not yet registered with the . If they later become registered, their lazy load data allows them to be restored to their previous location in the layout. If a layout is serialized without one of these windows being registered, normally it will discard the lazy load data so that it does not accumulate over time. Change this property to true to allow that lazy load data to be retained during serialization.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.Docking.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.
